content.question: Which of the following statements about income inequality is true?

choices.label: A low average household income in a society suggests significant income inequality.
A society with progressive income taxes will likely have a very unequal after-tax distribution of income.
Low taxes on savings tend to lead to a more equitable distribution of after-tax income.
Raising taxes on savings and providing subsidies to low-income households will lead to more equal after-tax and transfer incomes.
Low tax rates on wealth will lead to less unequal income distributions.

content.answer: Raising taxes on savings and providing subsidies to low-income households will lead to more equal after-tax and transfer incomes.
